alert.note: Alert for Southern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Columbia and Suwannee Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Live Oak to near Dowling Park to 9 miles west of Luraville to near Perry. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Wellborn, Obrien, Mcalpin, Luraville, Newburn and Houston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
